title: RIOT can we PLEASE have a talk!
body: so i'm attempting a name change form Perfect Deity to my ranked friends and whatnot to iDeity NOW this name is "taken" but i can guarantee this summoner isn't active AT ALL and has no recent games AT ALL so can i possibly be emailed or something to discuss the possibility of acquiring this name it would be a blessing. (psst...hey riot my birthday was 4 days ago, that would be an AMAZING gift!)

replies.body: you're in luck my friend, it seems it will be available at 06/14/2016 @ 10:09 pm CST

> [{quoted}](name=Shysterxd,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=0bMuanRn,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-06-14T01:33:22.097+0000)
>
> you're in luck my friend, it seems it will be available at 06/14/2016 @ 10:09 pm CST

how do you know? how did you find this out?
im interested aswell on how he found this out i can't even look up the account....

We actually do release Summoner Names of players who have not played in a long time.  You can learn about the specifics of this in our [Summoner Name Clean Up Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751914).

Essentially, level 30 accounts are given 2.5 years of inactivity before we release the name.  Once this account gets past this point, you should be able to claim it!

Is there a way to "offer" a name-change to someone who doesn't care a lot and would be ready to give up his current name but doesn't have the Points to do it?

I **really** want to get DeathBurst instead of DeathBurs7, and it's an account almost inactive with just a few Normals game once in a while, so I'd be ready to pay his name change, but I don't know if it is possible.
Unfortunately not :(  Unless you worked out a one-on-one deal where both parties change names right after each other, there is no set system for this.

Yeah, I did mean a one-on-one deal, but the other guy would never agree if he has to pay for the name-change himself. He could accept if he's not really attached to the name/account and if it doesn't cost him anything, but he has no reason to spend currency just to please me. My question was more about how I could pay for both his name-change and mine.

>We actually do release Summoner Names of players who have not played in a long time. 

I am not seeing this. Are you sure?

Oh. I thought you meant that there was like a list of names of players whos accounts are inactive or something like that. 

I understand now what you meant.

> [{quoted}](name=dArtagnan,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=0bMuanRn,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-06-14T01:16:21.847+0000)
>
> We actually do release Summoner Names of players who have not played in a long time.  You can learn about the specifics of this in our [Summoner Name Clean Up Article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751914).
> 
> Essentially, level 30 accounts are given 2.5 years of inactivity before we release the name.  Once this account gets past this point, you should be able to claim it!

Is there any way to tell how long an account has been inactive for, if we're looking to grab the name when that account loses its name?

I would recommend looking at that players match history in the client, or possibly looking them up in 3rd party websites that track player games played.  We aren't able to release specific information to you about when their last game played was however.
If my account is past that time and yet no one took the nae, can I still log in?
Yep!  Even if your name was taken, the account still exists.  You would just be prompted to pick a new name immediately after signing in!

wow thank you very much! i love how riot ACTUALLY came over and gave some details. i once again thank you all and i hope this sorted some opinions and questions of other summoners! keep up the great work fam!
